Chemistry (General Concepts).subject: Chemistry (General Concepts)
Chemistry (General Concepts).question:
Statement I: All compounds contain more than one element.
Statement II : All compounds are heterogeneous mixtures.
options: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I
Both the statements are individually true but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I
Statement I is true, but Statement II is false
Statement I is false, but Statement II is true
Chemistry (General Concepts).answer: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I
Chemistry (General Concepts).explanation: A heterogeneous mixture is a mixture of more than two elements.

Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).question: On the labels of the bottles, some soft drinks are claimed to be acidity regulators. They regulate acidity using
Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).explanation: In soft drinks bicarbonate salts acts as acidity regulators. Bicarbonate of soda is effective at regulating the pH levels of other substances; it ensures that the substance is neither too alkaline nor too acidic.

Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).question: Antacids are commonly used to get rid of acidity in the stomach. A commonly used antacid is
Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).explanation: Generally are weak bases. Antacid which naturalises stomach acidity, a commonly used antacid is magnesium hydroxide. Magnesium hydroxide is common component of antacids and laxatives.

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: Iodised salt is a
options: mixture of potassium iodide and common salt
mixture of molecular iodide and common salt
compound formed by combination of potassium iodide and common salt
compound formed by molecular iodine and common salt
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).answer: compound formed by combination of potassium iodide and common salt
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: Iodised salt is a compound formed by combination of potassium iodide and common salt.
